availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

figure.ab: JOHN BISSELL. NOTARY PUBLIC NEW YORK.

body.p: This Card is worth posting up -- and preserving for future reference.
JOHN BISSELL Counsellor at Law, Notary Public and Referee. No. 180 Broadway, cor. Dey street New York, after 1st April, 1862.
COMMISSIONER to take testimony, acknowledgements, &c., &c., for all the States and Territories of the Union, duly appointed by the Governors thereof.

Mr. Bissell originated and organized this as a distinct branch of business in 1832 -- he is familiar with the requisites, and has the various forms, precedents and blanks, printed for immediate use. He has never been professionally connected with one of a simlar name.
U. S. Passports obtained, and foreign passports, and other foreign documents authenticated.
Monies obtained or invested on Bond and Mortgage.
ALWAYS IN HIS OFFICE IN BUSINESS HOURS.
